pages.title: Block Light Detector
pages.text: $(item)Daylight Detectors$() are imprecise when it comes to measuring light: the $(item)Nether Quartz$() used is so crudely processed that only sunlight can trigger the detector reliably.$(br)Amethyst, shaped by a Pigment Pedestal, is much more sensitive when it comes to measuring light. Even the dim glow of a $(item)Torch$() is sufficient to output decent strength.

pages.title: Pedestal Recipe
pages.text: The Light Level Detector does not only react to sunlight, but is also able to pick up other light sources, like light emitting blocks.
